categories.explanation: All rules that are enforced here and on the forum.
Explanation of all HTTP error codes that the API returns.

messages.message: Everything is fine here, move along.

__**204 (No Content)**__
This error indicates that the server has not found a match for the API request being made. No indication is given whether the condition is temporary or permanent. This seems to be a common return value for the clash endpoints, where others would use 404. As of right now, this behaviour is expected but undocumented.
https://developer.riotgames.com/response-codes.html

**400**: If you're getting this message, you've most likely entered an incorrect summonerId or PUUID.
Applications are given a unique encryption on all IDs (summoner, account, and puuids). If you looked up a player on a different key you will need to use the same method to get the ID on the different application.

__**401 (Unauthorized)**__
This error indicates that the request being made did not contain the necessary authentication credentials (e.g., an API key) and therefore the client was denied access. The client should not continue to make similar requests without including an API key in the request.
**Common Reasons:**
An API key has not been included in the request.
An Invalid API key has been included in the request.

__**402 (Payment Required)**__
This error indicates that payment is required and the request has therefore been denied. The client should not continue to make similar requests without appropriate payment.

__**403 (Forbidden)**__
This error indicates that the API request being made did not contain the necessary authentication credentials and therefore the client was denied access. If authentication credentials were already included then the Unauthorized response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials. In the case of the API, authorization credentials refer to your API key.
**Common Reasons:**
A blacklisted API key was provided with the API request
The API request was for an incorrect or unsupported path (are you trying to use summoner/by-name, match-v4, or an endpoint that requires a summoner id?)
The requested match is unavailable through the API (match-v5 only)
https://developer.riotgames.com/response-codes.html

__**404 (Not Found)**__
This error indicates that the server has not found a match for the API request being made. No indication is given whether the condition is temporary or permanent.

**Common Reasons:**
The ID or name provided does not match any existing resource (e.g., there is no summoner matching the specified ID)
The API request was for an incorrect or unsupported path

https://developer.riotgames.com/response-codes.html
the url you have supplied to the server is too long... Make sure it is correct

__**415 (Unsupported Media Type)**__
This error indicates that the server is refusing to service the request because the body of the request is in a format that is not supported.

**Common Reasons:**
The `Content-Type` header was not appropriately set

https://developer.riotgames.com/response-codes.html

__**429 (Rate Limit Exceeded)**__
This error indicates that the application has exhausted its maximum number of allotted API calls allowed for a given duration. If the client receives a Rate Limit Exceeded response the client should process this response and halt future API calls for the duration, in seconds, indicated by the `Retry-After` header. **Applications that are in violation of this policy may have their access disabled to preserve the integrity of the API.** Please refer to our Rate Limiting documentation (https://developer.riotgames.com/rate-limiting.html) for more information on determining if you have been rate limited and how to avoid it.

**Common Reasons:**
Unregulated API calls. Check your API Call Graphs to monitor your Dev and Production API key activity.

https://developer.riotgames.com/response-codes.html

__**500 (Internal Server Error)**__
This error indicates an unexpected condition or exception which prevented the server from fulfilling an API request.

https://developer.riotgames.com/response-codes.html

__**503 (Service Unavailable)**__
This error indicates the server is currently unavailable to handle requests because of an unknown reason. The Service Unavailable response implies a temporary condition which will be alleviated after some delay.

https://developer.riotgames.com/response-codes.html

The Riot Games API **does not** provide aggregated data of any kind. This means if you see pick rates, win rates, etc. these are calculated by the third party themselves.
If you would like this data yourself you will need to collect a lot of matches and calculate by your metric.
A guide on crawling matches (For League of Legends but can be adapted to all games):
<https://hextechdocs.dev/crawling-matches-using-the-riot-games-api/>
https://developer.riotgames.com/api-methods/
https://developer.riotgames.com/api-methods/
https://querijn.codes/api_status/
The API status page should not be relied on as there are numerous endpoints incorrectly listed or not listed at all.

You need a URL that can describe your app. If this is a web application it can be the URL of your app. If it is not, it will need to be a page describing your application including screenshots so that Rioters can fully understand your application. Rioters will not download any app, join any discord server, etc.
If you are having issues with verification:
Verify you can curl your URL and only get the text that riot provided (No HTML etc). You can use <https://reqbin.com/curl> and type ``curl https://www.yourdomain.com/riot.txt`` and press Run. If the response returns anything but the code provided you will need to fix this.

What is your app ID? You can find this by going to https://developer.riotgames.com/apps, selecting your project from the list on the left, and copying the number in the URL (https://developer.riotgames.com/app/YOUR_APP_ID_IS_HERE/info)

Client-side calls are blocked because there is no way to make them without exposing your API key to users. You will need to setup a backend server that can make API calls while keeping your API key secure. If you want to quickly setup a proxy server, you can create some functions with AWS Lambda (<https://pastebin.com/LYsyfGgD>) or use Kernel (<https://github.com/meraki-analytics/kernel>).
If your project is only intended for personal usage, you can modify your browser settings to disable CORS (the mechanism which blocks you from making client-side calls). However, you will not be allowed to publish your site if you do this. More info about disabling CORS can be found here: <https://www.thepolyglotdeveloper.com/2014/08/bypass-cors-errors-testing-apis-locally/>

To get the cs count shown in game:
``neutralMinionsKilled`` + ``totalMinionsKilled``

League of Legends custom game data is now available through the Riot Games API for applications with RSO. These options do not include tournament realm games (See <#976954581076553769> for esports data)
Official Methods:
1. Use lol-rso-match-v1 https://developer.riotgames.com/apis#lol-rso-match-v1 you can use this with a RSO token. See pins of <#946641562757107782> for more information on RSO.
2. Use the Tournament API. This requires specific approval with a production app. You can generate tournament codes then gather data using the callback or getting the game id from the tournament code. This option is made for tournaments only, there have been exceptions but Riot has not been as lenient on giving those out recently.
To read about Tournament API:
<https://developer.riotgames.com/docs/lol#tournament-api>
<https://developer.riotgames.com/apis#tournament-v5>
Unofficial Method:
Using the <#516802588805431296> . This requires you to run a program on a player's computer that participated in the game (match history does not show for spectators). You will need to build your own application and upload the match files to your server using your application or manually. The LCU is not an officially supported resource so documentation isn't as readily available.
To read about the LCU:
<https://hextechdocs.dev/getting-started-with-the-lcu-api/>
<https://swagger.dysolix.dev/lcu/#/Plugin%20lol-match-history/GetLolMatchHistoryV1ProductsLolByPuuidMatches>
<https://swagger.dysolix.dev/lcu/#/Plugin%20lol-match-history/GetLolMatchHistoryV1GamesByGameId>
<https://swagger.dysolix.dev/lcu/#/Plugin%20lol-match-history/GetLolMatchHistoryV1GameTimelinesByGameId>

You can format your code in a message enclosing it in three backticks ( \` ) to make your code readable. You can add your language after the backticks to add code highlighting.
Example:
\`\`\`js
console.log("Hello World!");
\`\`\`
Turns into:
```js
console.log("Hello World");
```

Community Gurus are just normal developers that Rioters have recognized as being very knowledgeable about the API and the community, as well as trustworthy. Their main purpose is to be a good and reliable source of information about the API to the community. They are empowered to moderate the forums and the discord server if the code of conduct rules are broken.

"Gurus are trustworthy, trust me" ~ A Guru
See !help for a list of all commands or !note for a list of all notes.
Stop it. Get some help.

**Applications:** Expect a minimum of six weeks, three-six months is typical.
**Messages:** Expect a minimum of six weeks. Since they review specific date ranges, submitting multiple messages may kick you to the back of the queue.
**How to speed up the process:** Wait faster or time travel. For time travel we recommend 2019 or 2020 for League apps and 2023 for Valorant apps.
*Not responsible for paradoxes, time loops, or accidental future vacations.*
*If your app status is unverified, type `/note app-verify` or `!note app-verify` for more information*
https://hextechdocs.dev/

**Summoner and Account ids:**
SummonerId endpoints were removed <t:1750395600:R>. SummonerIds and AccountIds were removed from endpoint responses beginning <t:1751864400:R>. You should use PUUID equivalents for all endpoints now.
**Encryption**:
All ids returned by the Riot Games API are encrypted. This means they will be tied to the application they were originally generated for. This means if you pull ids from one application (like a developer key) you will not be able to use them with another application (like a personal or production key). You must get these ids how you originally got them again, likely through Account-V1. There are situations like with RSO that Riot can merge encryption across apps but this is not the default.

The League-V4 and TFT-League-V1 endpoints only return **current** league entries, no past entries and no unranked entries.
**If you are getting an empty array response**:
The summoner is unranked. (All provisional games must be finished before their rank will appear)
**If a site has past ranks:**
This means they have been gathering ranks since the past and storing them in their database. The API does not directly provide this information.
**If a site has LP gains/losses:**
This means they are gathering ranks before & after matches, either directly through summoner entries or paging through in bulk and timestamping. If you would like this information you must store it yourself.

Match data is retained for 2 years, match timelines for 1 year. A player's match list will only show up to the last 1000 matches played. Non-public games (customs, practice tool, etc.) count towards the 1000 match limit so it may never hold exactly 1000. Games exceeding the limit but not exceeding the retention period will only be accessible through the match list of another player that participated in the game, or directly by the match id.

If you get a gameId from the client or tournament api you will need to add the platform prefix to the gameId to get a matchId.
For example if you're playing on EUW and your gameId is 6553947989 the matchId will be EUW1_6553947989.
Custom game data is still unavailable from Match-V5 even if you have the matchId, you can use Lol-rso-match-v1 for this if you have a production application with access to RSO.

match-v4 was removed from the API <t:1632715200:R>. Any code, documentation or examples referencing match-v4 should be considered incorrect and will need to be updated. Match-v5 (<https://developer.riotgames.com/apis#match-v5>) is the replacement. Take note the parameters have changed from match-v4.

You can create a mobile app that uses the API, but you'll need to create a webpage to explain the app, and a server to proxy your API calls. The website should contain enough information so that Rioters can evaluate your project (to ensure it isn't breaking any rules) without actually downloading it. You'll also need to setup a server to make your API calls from. You cannot securely store your API key in a distributed app, so your app will need to communicate with a server, which will in turn communicate with the API.

<https://developer.riotgames.com/docs/portal#web-apis_rate-limiting>
You must always respect the __**lowest**__ rate limit you have out of all limits.
**Application Rate Limits**
These rate limits are per region and effect all methods for this region. Platform and regional routing are different "regions".
Rule of thumb for this is per *subdomain* this means *na1* is different app limits from *americas* and *euw1* etc.
The base limits are 20 requests every 1 second and 100 requests every 2 minutes and you can request higher limits in a production application by submitting a ticket and explaining your needs after utilizing your limit.
**Method Rate Limits**
Each endpoint has a rate limit. You can see your method limits by going to the developer portal and going to your apps page.
As noted above your method limit may be above your application limit, you still need to respect the application limit.
It is per endpoint this means ``/riot/account/v1/accounts/by-puuid/{puuid}`` is a different method than ``/riot/account/v1/accounts/by-riot-id/{gameName}/{tagLine}``
**Service Rate Limits/Other Limits**
These are limits that are set by riot for their services. You have no control over these limits. You will get a ``X-Rate-Limit-Type: service``for service limits and no ``X-Rate-Limit-Type`` header in the response for other rate limits. They both normally reset quickly and you usually can just retry the request and it will be successful. These will not have a ``Retry-After`` header meaning you cannot know when they will resolve.

The algorithm used to calculate the ``role`` and ``lane`` values often generates incorrect values, use ``teamPosition`` and ``individualPosition`` instead.
> Both individualPosition and teamPosition are computed by the game server and are different versions of the most likely position played by a player. The individualPosition is the best guess for which position the player actually played in isolation of anything else. The teamPosition is the best guess for which position the player actually played if we add the constraint that each team must have one top player, one jungle, one middle, etc. Generally the recommendation is to use the teamPosition field over the individualPosition field.

As listed on the top of the developer portal:
> The AMERICAS routing value serves NA, BR, LAN and LAS. The ASIA routing value serves KR and JP. The EUROPE routing value serves EUNE, EUW, TR and RU. The SEA routing value serves OCE, PH2, SG2, TH2, TW2 and VN2.

> RSO is Riot Sign On, standard OAuth2 that allows you to verify users own an account.
> You need an approved production application and then apply to use RSO on the beta developer portal at <https://beta.developer.riotgames.com/>
> For detailed questions on usage look at the pins and ask in <#946641562757107782>
> or see the examples at: <https://github.com/RiotGames/developer-relations/tree/main/sample_apps/rso_sample_apps>

The /me endpoints and any endpoints requiring an ``Authorization`` Header require an access token from RSO. Unless you need to verify the users identity you are most likely looking for another endpoint. To learn more about RSO type ``!note rso`` or see <#946641562757107782>

This Discord server is for the Riot Games API, a tool which provides data to sites like op.gg. All Rioters here that are working officially are part of the team that manages the API, and will not be able to help you with support or gameplay issues. If you're having account related issues or technical problems, contact Riot Games support: <https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us>. If you have a game-related suggestion or feedback, post on the subreddit, or the League of Legends Discord: <https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/> / <https://discordapp.com/invite/lol>

Using a Riot API wrapper makes working with the API much easier, and is highly recommended for everyone (especially beginners). If you use a wrapper, you don't need to worry about things like rate limiting or properly formatting requests. You can find a list of libraries by PM <@!293623987051823107> `!libs <Your language of choice>`
https://developer.riotgames.com/ddragon.html

> Summoner names were removed on November 20th 2023. League of Legends will now use Riot IDs in their place.
> -
> Summoner names have been transitioned out of the API responses starting April 8th 2024.
> -
> Use Account-V1 by gameName/tagLine as a replacement for Summoner-V4 by-name endpoint. <https://developer.riotgames.com/apis#account-v1/GET_getByRiotId>
> -
> You can use the PUUID from that endpoint with Summoner-V4 by-puuid to get the same summoner information as you were getting before <https://developer.riotgames.com/apis#summoner-v4/GET_getByPUUID>
> -
> You can read more about the transition here: <https://www.riotgames.com/en/DevRel/summoner-names-to-riot-id>

Some of the API calls being shared are still using `summoner-v4/by-name`, which has been retired. The correct endpoint to use now is **`account-v1`**.
If AI suggested that call, remember: AI is a tool to help you, not a replacement for understanding or verifying your code. Always double-check endpoints and parameters against the [official Riot API reference](https://developer.riotgames.com/apis) before using them.

If you are using https, it probably won't work due to a newer certificate in your chain, http is much more reliable. (If the certificate authority in your chain is issued after 2012 it won't work, there are very few issuers who fall into this category)
If you are using a newer uncommon TLD (something other than .com, .net, etc.) verify it is supported on the link above.
Tournament callbacks are only done when the game is fully complete, meaning the nexus has exploded.
You can test your callback endpoint using the sample data provided in the link above.

The tournament stub is an API available to developer and personal keys for development of the Tournament API. It helps you build the flow of the Tournament API into your application. The codes it generates are not real codes and will be the same every time.
Once your product is built you can apply for a production key with tournament access to use Tournament-V5 for the ability to generate real tournament codes.

If you'd prefer to speak to somebody in your native language, there is a list of volunteer translators pinned in #off-topic. These people can help you directly in your native language, or translate messages so somebody else can help you.

This server is for approved usage of resources that Riot has made available to 3rd party developers. Store checkers or similar apps, or any application that prompts a user for their Riot Games credentials are not officially approved use case. The only supported use of Riot authentication on this server is with an approved application and RSO client credentials through the developer portal (https://developer.riotgames.com/)
<https://www.riotgames.com/en/DevRel/player-universally-unique-identifiers-and-a-new-security-layer>

VALORANT endpoints such as VAL-MATCH-V1 are available to **production applications only**. This is due to the way VALORANT handles private user data, requiring opt-ins from RSO to display data publicly.
This means if you want data from the API you will need to create a **publicly available application**.
Developer keys will not have access and there are no personal keys for VALORANT.
You can build your application for approval by either mocking data or using the sample data in the pinned messages of <#694820049063510026>
As of 2023-08-28 GitHub verification is no longer acceptable.

**DDragon**: You can find the available versions here: http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/api/versions.json. The current version is {ddragonVersion}.
**Game**: The game is currently at version {gameVersion}.

No, we're not angry. The issue here is that we deal with this so many times, even though we have so many barriers in place to ensure that you know about your issue beforehand, but you seem to just blatantly disregard them just for sake of some sweet sweet Rioter interaction. We're fully aware of your issue but nobody, and even the Rioters here, are able to help you. Your efforts are fruitless, in vain, and frankly, it's really annoying having to deal with them now. Imagine having to re-iterate something to someone just because they don't want to understand, instead of not being able to understand. It's.. it's something else.
